entry.title: Cathie Wood on Bitcoin, Tech, Venture Capital, and Innovation
New York Attorney General Files Lawsuit Against Kucoin and Declares Ethereum a Security
entry.summary:
On March 9, 2023, New York attorney general Letitia James announced that her office had once again cracked down on crypto platforms by filing a lawsuit against the Seychelles-based crypto exchange Kucoin. Members of the Office of the Attorney General (OAG) were able to purchase crypto assets, despite the exchange not being registered in the state. In addition to the lawsuit, James and the OAG insist that the second-largest crypto asset by market capitalization, ethereum, is a security.
Why Ethereum Is Considered a Security According to New York‚Äôs OAG
Two weeks ago, New York attorney general Letitia James and the Office of the Attorney General (OAG) filed a lawsuit against Coinex. On Thursday, the OAG filed a lawsuit against the crypto trading platform Kucoin. The charges against Kucoin‚Ä¶

entry.title: US Accounting Watchdog Issues Warning on Crypto Proof-of-Reserve Audits: Investors Urged to Exercise Caution
entry.summary:
According to a recent warning by the U.S. Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB), crypto proof-of-reserve (POR) audits have limitations, and the board believes that investors should exercise caution when dealing with companies using POR audits.
PCAOB Calls for Investor Caution and Due Diligence When Using Proof-of-Reserve Reports
The U.S. accounting watchdog recently issued an advisory warning about auditors using proof-of-reserve (POR) techniques to audit specific crypto companies, such as exchanges and stablecoin issuers. The Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) stated that it is aware of certain PCAOB-registered audit firms issuing POR reports for these types of businesses. The PCAOB expressed concerns that investors ‚Äúmay place undue reliance on POR reports.‚Äù‚Ä¶

entry.title: KuCoin Lawsuit Could Set Dangerous Precedent For Ethereum
entry.summary:
The New York District Attorney General (NYDA), Letitia James, filed a lawsuit against crypto exchange KuCoin. According to a document filed with the Supreme Court of the State of New York against two companies running the trading venue in the U.S., PhoenixFin and Mek Global Limited.
The lawsuit accuses KuCoin of offering unregistered securities and commodities in New York. These digital assets are the former native token of Terra‚Äôs collapsed ecosystem, LUNA, its algorithmic stablecoin UST, and Ethereum (ETH), the second crypto by market capitalization.
The document failed to provide details on which tokens fall under the security classification and which are commodities. If Ethereum falls under the former and the jurisdiction of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), its ecos‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Outflows Show Huge Spike, Whales Going On Shopping Spree?
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows exchanges have observed a vast Bitcoin outflow recently, a sign that whales may be going on a buying spree of the asset.
Bitcoin Exchange Netflows Have Been Negative In Recent Days
An analyst in a CryptoQuant post pointed out that around 10,000 BTC flowed out of exchanges yesterday. The relevant indicator here is the ‚Äúall exchanges netflow,‚Äù which measures the net amount of Bitcoin entering or exiting the wallets of all centralized exchanges. The metric‚Äôs value is calculated by dividing the inflows and outflows.
When the indicator records a positive value, the inflows are more significant than the outflows, and a net amount of BTC is moving into exchanges. If these deposits are heading towards spot exchanges, BTC could feel a bearish impact as investors usually us‚Ä¶

entry.title: Integrating Cryptocurrencies in E-Commerce: Opportunities and Risks in 2023
entry.summary:
Cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum have made headlines in recent years due to their dramatic price fluctuations and potential to disrupt traditional financial systems.

The use of cryptocurrencies in e-commerce, on the other hand, is a relatively new and unexplored concept. In this article, we'll look at the benefits and drawbacks of incorporating cryptocurrencies into e-commerce.

Cryptocurrency Integration Possibilities in E-Commerce

Global Reach

One of the most significant advantages of cryptocurrencies is their ability to facilitate quick and secure global transactions. Cryptocurrencies, unlike traditional payment methods, are not subject to exchange rates or international transaction fees, making them an appealing option for b‚Ä¶

entry.title: Expert Warns of Possible Deflationary Depression as Money Supply Contracts: ‚ÄòPay Attention to QT and the Money Supply‚Äô
entry.summary:
During the Covid-19 pandemic, central banks such as the U.S. Federal Reserve loosened fiscal and monetary policy. Now, these same financial institutions are seemingly engaging in quantitative tightening (QT) practices. According to Nick Gerli, CEO and founder of Reventure Consulting, ‚Äúthe money supply is officially contracting.‚Äù This has only happened four times in the last 150 years. Gerli warns that every time it occurs, a depression takes place with double-digit unemployment rates.
The Contraction of Money Supply and its Impact on the Economy
Several market analysts and economists are uncertain about the future of the economy, while many believe things will soon get worse due to significant inflation and failures in central planning. When the Covid-19 pandemic hit, the U.S. governme‚Ä¶

entry.title: Gate Group Expands Payment Offerings With New Visa Debit Card Rollout In Europe
entry.summary:
Gate Group, the company behind the popular exchange Gate.io, plans to launch a European crypto debit card to expand its reach to European countries.¬†Users can seamlessly convert and spend their crypto assets with the card in everyday purchases.¬†
One of the factors that push adoption in the crypto space is continuous developments. As each firm operating in the sector expands its reach to different countries, more users will join the industry, increasing knowledge and eventual adoption.¬†
Gate.io Debit Card To Push Adoption¬†
Gate Group plans to launch the card with the support of its Lithuania-based company Gate Global UAB. According to a Twitter post, the card will enable users to complete crypto-to-fiat conversions for online and in-store purchases.
It will make the process faster‚Ä¶

entry.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson coined the term ‚Äúmetaverse‚Äù in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel ‚ÄúSnow Crash.‚Äù Now he‚Äôs helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in ‚ÄúSnow Crash,‚Äù goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver

entry.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'

entry.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast
entry.summary: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.

entry.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace
entry.summary: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."

entry.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini
entry.summary: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."

entry.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'
entry.summary: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.

entry.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria
entry.summary: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."

entry.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next
entry.summary: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next‚Äîincluding token-gated sneaker drops.

entry.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs
entry.summary: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.

entry.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'
entry.summary: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."
